ygData.messageBody:
could have been a specific incident. i haden't been above the surface for
hours, i never attacked this judi, and he just kept blasting me. by the
time i knew what was happening it was too late. took a while talking with
the GM, and having him talk to my group, but he said it was indeed a bug.

Shada

> From: Kyle [mailto:ksibbald@...]

> I think you got lucky, had a very sympathetic GM, or
> are a really good
> talker. I've heard from Beta friends that this particular
> double standard
> was implemented back in beta because some spellcasters were levitating
> themselves, running off the nearest cliff, and shelling mobs
> with direct
> damage spells from what effectively constituted as a 'safe
> zone'. To fix
> this they enabled mobs to attack you across any vertical distance.
> I suppose there could be two additional solutions to
> correct this
> inconsistency.
>
> 1. Disallow casting when levitated. Nah. That would
> totally screw over
> casters in the plane of Air as I understand it.
>
> 2. Allow players to attack mobs across any vertical
> distance. Possible,
> even if it is not really realistic. Imagine a warrior on the ground
> underneath the Aviak Village in South Karana hitting aviaks up in the
> highest building. =/
>
> Good Journey,
>
> Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)
